snippet: President Obama and his team see Congress’s action, either approval or rejection, as a guidepost that goes well beyond the question of an attack on Syria.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama and his advisers view Congress's coming decision on military action against Syria as potential turning point that could effectively define his foreign policy for his final three years in office; Obama's team says if Congress rejects a strike in Syria and he acts anyway, it could set off an effort to impeach him, as well as hinder his commitment of military forces elsewhere.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and his team see Congress’s action, either approval or rejection, as a guidepost that goes well beyond the question of an attack on Syria.

headline.print_headline: White House Looks at Vote As Rudder for Rest of Term
headline.main: White House Looks to Syria Vote as Rudder for  Rest of Term
